title: 'But I have to go to ... ': PM Modi says turned down Trump's invite for Odisha visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi revealed he declined a dinner invitation from US President Donald Trump during the G7 summit in Canada. Modi prioritized attending a public program in Odisha and visiting the revered land of Mahaprabhu.

title: Trapped in conflict zone: Scores of Indians still stranded in Iran, Israel; anxiety stalks kin
content: Amid escalating conflict between Iran and Israel, numerous Indian nationals, including students and pilgrims, are stranded, facing uncertain and risky returns. Indian embassies are coordinating evacuations, yet communication with some individuals remains difficult, causing immense distress to families back in India. Efforts are underway to provide assistance and facilitate their safe passage through neighboring countries.

title: 'She was to be my daughter-in-law‚Äô: 55-year-old man marries son‚Äôs fianc√©e
content: In Rampur, Uttar Pradesh, a shocking incident unfolded as 55-year-old Shakeel married Ayesha, the woman initially engaged to his 17-year-old son, Aman. This unexpected union has left Shakeel's family in turmoil. Shabana, Shakeel's wife, revealed his frequent communication with Ayesha after their daughter's wedding. Despite family resistance, Shakeel allegedly forced the match.

title: Amazon's ultimatum: Company tells employees to choose - 30 days to ... or resign in 60 days
content: Amazon is requiring numerous corporate employees to relocate to major hubs like Seattle and Arlington, creating anxiety amidst job insecurity and AI-driven workforce reductions. Affected employees face short deadlines to decide, with no severance offered for those who resign instead of moving. This relocation push intensifies Amazon's in-office requirements and aligns with warnings of upcoming AI-related layoffs.

title: Musk bets on India: Tesla to open showrooms in July; ‚ÄòMade in China‚Äô EV may cost more than $56,000
content: Tesla is set to debut in India this July with showrooms in Mumbai and New Delhi, importing Model Y SUVs from its Shanghai facility. Despite high import duties pushing the price above $56,000, Tesla aims to penetrate the cost-conscious Indian market.

title: Day 8: Israel targets Iran's interal security headquarters
content: The Israeli Air Force conducted strikes in Tehran earlier this week, targeting Iran's "Internal Security headquarters" and the headquarters of its "special internal security unit," according to military sources. The IDF, acting on precise intelligence, employed fighter jets to attack these key internal security mechanisms, which are integral parts of the Iranian regime's military apparatus, located within the Tehran area.

title: 16 billion passwords leaked: What you need to know to protect your accounts
content: A massive data breach has exposed 16 billion login credentials across 30 databases, impacting users of major platforms like Facebook, Instagram, and Gmail. Researchers discovered the unprecedented leak, revealing fresh, weaponizable intelligence for cybercriminals. Experts urge immediate password changes, multi-factor authentication, and monitoring of accounts to mitigate potential exploitation.

title: 8-hour silence after morning quarrel; elderly couple, son found hanging
content: A Kolkata family of three, Sarajit Bhattacharya (70), Gargi (68), and their son Ayusman (38), were found dead in their apartment, in Rajdanga Gold Park. Police suspect financial strain and the son's depression led to the tragic suicide. A note stated, "We are surrendering ourselves to God," requesting a joint cremation.

title: IND vs ENG: Debut disaster! Sai Sudharsan registers rare low for India after seven years
content: Sai Sudharsan's Test debut against England at Headingley turned sour after India's promising start to the Anderson‚ÄìTendulkar Trophy series. The highly-rated batter, receiving India Test Cap No. 317, fell for a duck after edging a Ben Stokes delivery. Sudharsan's dismissal followed a 91-run opening stand by KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal.

title: 'Heavy rainfall jumlas': Lalu shares AI video attacking PM Modi, CM Nitish; watch
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal chief Lalu Prasad Yadav released a satirical video targeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. The video criticizes the NDA's promises ahead of the 2025 Bihar elections. PM Modi visited Siwan, Bihar, inaugurating development projects. He attacked the Congress-RJD alliance. Modi highlighted Bihar's role in India's economic growth.

title: When Steve Jobs gifted brand new Jaguar to secretary after he got late to office
content: Steve Jobs, known for his demanding leadership, once gifted a late secretary a Jaguar to prevent future tardiness, showcasing his paradoxical nature of being both intimidating and inspiring. Ron Givens, Apple's former quality director, shared anecdotes of Jobs' unexpected generosity and relentless pursuit of excellence. Jobs' high expectations extended to late-night calls, as recalled by Pixar's Pete Docter.

title: Honeymoon murder: Sonam wore burqa during 1,000km drive to UP
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, accused of her husband Raja's murder during their honeymoon in Meghalaya, was apprehended after fleeing to Uttar Pradesh disguised in a burqa. Police investigations in Indore have questioned drivers who aided her escape, while in Shillong, Sonam and her alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha, remain in police custody as the probe widens.

title: Video shows Bengal school children using umbrellas in class under leaking roof
content: BJP IT cell chief Amit Malviya has criticized the West Bengal government, led by Mamata Banerjee, for alleged neglect of school infrastructure. Malviya highlighted a situation in Hooghly district where 68 schoolchildren, aged 5 to 10, were forced to sit with umbrellas in classrooms due to a leaking roof.

title: Former Delhi deputy CM Manish Sisodia appears before ACB, questioned for over 3 hours
content: Manish Sisodia, a senior AAP leader, appeared before the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on June 20 for questioning regarding the alleged Delhi classroom construction scam. The ACB is investigating irregularities and a large-scale scam involving inflated costs in the construction of classrooms and school buildings. Sisodia's questioning, conducted with an independent witness, lasted from 11:00 am to 2:30 pm.

title: Dwyane Wade's wife Gabrielle Union shows support for Victoria Mon√©t in heartfelt post
content: Gabrielle Union is set to moderate Victoria Mon√©t's book launch event in Los Angeles for her new children's book, 'Everywhere You Are.' Union reposted Mon√©t's announcement on Instagram, expressing her support for the book, which explores themes of love and connection. The event promises a discussion and Q&A session, with both mothers and authors sharing their insights.

title: '60 fighter jets in action': How Israel pulled off overnight airstrikes on Iran - watch video
content: Israeli Defense Forces conducted extensive strikes on Iranian military targets, including the Organisation of Defensive Innovation and Research (SPND), linked to Iran's nuclear program. The operation involved over 60 fighter jets targeting missile manufacturing facilities and the SPND headquarters. These strikes are part of an escalating conflict, prompting diplomatic efforts from European officials as the US considers involvement.

title: From Holocaust to Hydrogen: How Israel become a 'nuclear power'; with help from US
content: Israeli leaders have consistently refused to confirm or deny the existence of nuclear weapons. The official line‚Äîrepeated by every prime minister‚Äîis that Israel ‚Äúwill not be the first country to introduce nuclear weapons into the Middle East.‚Äù The sentence is a masterpiece of political sleight of hand: vague enough to deflect, but strong enough to deter.

title: Nifty50 ends above 25,100; BSE Sensex up over 1,000 points - top reasons for rally
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, rallied strongly in trade on Friday. While Nifty50 went above 25,100, BSE Sensex moved up over 1,000 points.

title: IND vs ENG: 'All the more special' - Karun Nair's wife Sanaya pens emotional post
content: Karun Nair's emotional return to the Indian Test team after eight years was celebrated by his wife, Sanaya Tankariwala, with a heartfelt social media post. Nair, who last played in 2017, replaced in the squad, marking a significant moment in his career. India, under new captain Shubman Gill, included Sai Sudharsan's debut in the first Test against England.

title: Bihar train accident: Railway trolly collides with Avadh Assam Express; 1 dead
content: A railway worker tragically died, and three others were seriously injured in Bihar's Katihar district when a railway trolley collided with the Avadh Assam Express. The accident took place on the Barauni‚ÄìKatihar down line, prompting railway officials to dispatch a medical team to provide immediate assistance to the injured at the accident spot.

title: CM Nitish Kumar praises PM for caste census; asks Bihar voters to express gratitude
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar urged citizens to thank Prime Minister Narendra Modi for the decision to conduct a caste census alongside the 2027 population census. This follows Bihar's own caste census conducted between 2022 and 2023, which revealed that Extremely Backward Classes and Other Backward Classes constitute a significant 63% of the state's population.

title: IND vs ENG: India, England players observe minute's silence, wear black armbands
content: In a poignant tribute, the India and England cricket teams honored the 274 victims of the Ahmedabad air disaster with a minute's silence and black armbands at Headingley. The tragic crash, claiming the lives of Indian and British citizens, deeply affected both teams as they commenced their five-Test series.

title: 'Test cricket was better with Virat': Nasser on batter's impact as Gill era begins
content: As Team India begins a new Test cricket chapter under Shubman Gill at Headingley, Virat Kohli's absence is keenly felt. Nasser Hussain lauded Kohli's impact, recalling his fiery leadership during the 2021 Lord's Test. With key players missing, India face England, marking a symbolic shift in the post-Kohli era, with Sai Sudharsan debuting and Karun Nair returning.

title: Bill Belichick under fire: NFL legend Shawne Merriman warns, UNC career at risk over Jordon Hudson ties
content: Bill Belichick's relationship with Jordon Hudson are raising concerns about his potential involvement with the University of North Carolina. Former NFL player Shawne Merriman warns this situation could lead to 'psychological warfare,' jeopardizing Belichick's reputation and a team's focus.

title: Air India fares drop after Boeing 787 crash
content: Following the Air India Boeing 787 Dreamliner crash, fares have significantly decreased on both domestic and international routes, with some routes experiencing drops of up to 24%. Air India CEO Campbell Wilson stated that the crashed aircraft had undergone recent checks and monitoring, showing no prior issues.

title: Brandon Aiyuk sends clear message to San Francisco 49ers
content: Kansas City Chiefs may target Brandon Aiyuk before the 2025 season. Aiyuk seeks a long-term deal, around $23 million annually. This move could boost the Chiefs' offense and aid Patrick Mahomes. Aiyuk hinted at leaving the 49ers. Experts suggest the Chiefs will pursue Aiyuk if he is available. Mahomes has been training with young receivers.

title: Ryan Lochte owes $270K in debt after divorce from model Kayla Reid
content: Ryan Lochte, the former Olympic swimming champion, faces serious financial difficulties amidst his divorce from Kayla Rae Reid. Divorce filings revealed Lochte is in debt by more than $270,000, including significant unpaid taxes to the IRS and substantial medical bills. This marks a stark contrast to his celebrated past, leaving fans questioning his ability to recover financially and personally.

title: India vs England 1st Test: Why June 20 means so much to Indian cricket
content: June 20th continues to be a significant date for Indian Test debuts as Sai Sudharsan received his Test Cap No. 317 against England at Headingley. Following in the footsteps of Dravid, Ganguly, and Kohli, Sudharsan, the IPL 2025 Orange Cap winner, steps into a rebuilding Indian side at No. 3.

title: Wayne Gretzky opens up about how his father tried to stop nickname from sticking
content: Wayne Gretzky's iconic nickname, 'The Great One,' faced initial resistance from his father, Walter. Despite concerns about pressure, the name stuck as Gretzky dominated youth hockey. He later embraced it, exceeding expectations with a record-breaking NHL career. Gretzky also commented on the Edmonton Oilers' recent loss to the Florida Panthers. His journey reflects humility, brilliance, and lasting greatness in hockey.

title: Why Israel-Iran conflict is ripping MAGA apart
content: As tensions with Iran escalate, Donald Trump faces a rebellion within his own MAGA coalition. Once united by promises to end ‚Äústupid wars,‚Äù the movement is now split between anti-war voices like Tucker Carlson, Steve Bannon, and Matt Gaetz, and hawkish figures like Ted Cruz and Marco Rubio. Vice President JD Vance remains loyally silent, echoing Trump‚Äôs shifting stance. With the base wary of another Middle Eastern conflict, Trump‚Äôs strategy of maximum pressure without direct action is being tested. The bigger battle may not be with Tehran‚Äîbut within MAGA itself, as its identity fractures over the meaning of ‚ÄúAmerica First.‚Äù

title: Morning vs evening: Choosing the best time to take blood pressure medicine; expert insight explained
content: Recent studies suggest that taking blood pressure pills at night might be better. A study showed reduced risks of heart attacks and strokes with evening doses. Morning dosing has been the traditional advice. But night dosing could help restore a healthy blood pressure dip during sleep. Consult your doctor before changing your medication schedule.

title: IND vs ENG: Gill's India begin new Test era at Headingley; check out playing XIs
content: Shubman Gill's captaincy began with England winning the toss and electing to bowl in the first Test at Headingley. India debuted Sai Sudharsan and welcomed back Karun Nair after eight years, marking significant changes in their batting lineup.

title: Karun Nair returns to India‚Äôs Test XI after 2,763 days; Eng win toss and opt to bowl at Headingley
content: India chose to bat first against England. Shubman Gill leads a young team. Karun Nair makes a comeback after seven years. He last played in March 2017. Nair shares his journey and determination. He mentions staying patient and enjoying small things. Nair is excited to play with KL Rahul and Prasidh Krishna. India begins a new World Test Championship cycle.

title: War, power, and Les Mis√©rables: 10 facts about Iran's Khamenei
content: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran's Supreme Leader, faces escalating challenges amid Israeli strikes and regional instability. Despite his reclusive nature, Khamenei wields immense power over Iran's military, nuclear program, and foreign policy. He has built a network of regional proxies while suppressing domestic dissent, all while maintaining a surprising appreciation for literature.

title: 'Hand & lantern greatly hurt self-respect of Bihar': PM Modi attacks oppn at Siwan rally
content: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated development projects in Bihar, including flagging off a locomotive for export to Guinea under the 'Make in India' initiative and launching the Vande Bharat Express between Patliputra and Gorakhpur.

title: Sai Sudharsan makes Test debut at Headingley as England opt to bowl first
content: Sai Sudharsan receives his first Test cap as India faces England at Headingley, commencing their new World Test Championship cycle. Shubman Gill, after winning the toss, elected to bat first on a green pitch. The inclusion of the 23-year-old Sudharsan at No.

title: Ram Kapoor‚Äôs weight loss Diet: He Looses 55 kilos naturally; through this diet
content: Actor Ram Kapoor's remarkable weight loss journey in 2024 saw him shed over 55 kgs naturally in 18 months. Eschewing surgery, the 51-year-old adopted a simple yet effective strategy: two meals a day, no snacking, and no food after 6:30 pm.

title: Delhi girl dies in Canada: Found dead under mysterious circumstances; was studying at university
content: Tanya Tyagi, an Indian student from Delhi pursuing a Master‚Äôs in Food Safety and Quality at the University of Calgary, died suddenly under mysterious circumstances on June 19, 2025. The Indian Consulate in Vancouver is coordinating with Canadian authorities to assist her bereaved family. While an unverified social media post cited a heart attack as the cause, official details remain unclear. The family has appealed to the Indian government for help in repatriating her body.

title: Clash during Kedarnath Yatra: Parking staffers assault pilgrims with sticks
content: A shocking video from the Kedarnath Yatra route shows pilgrims being brutally assaulted with sticks by parking staff at Sitapur. The Sonprayag police swiftly responded to the viral video, confirming the incident and dispatching a team to investigate. The altercation reportedly stemmed from a dispute between pilgrims and parking employees.

title: Air India plane suffers bird hit in Pune: Return flight cancelled
content: An Air India flight, AI-2469, carrying over 100 passengers experienced a bird hit upon landing at Pune airport on Friday morning after arriving from Delhi. Consequently, the return flight, AI-2470 from Pune to Delhi, was cancelled. Air India is providing accommodation, refunds, and alternative travel arrangements for affected passengers, prioritizing safety while addressing the disruption.

title: President moved to tears as differently-abled students sing birthday song for her
content: President Droupadi Murmu celebrated her birthday in Uttarakhand, visibly moved by a song from visually impaired students. Her visit includes laying the foundation for a new public park and opening Rashtrapati Niketan and Tapovan to the public. However, her scheduled trip to Madhya Pradesh for World Sickle Cell Day has been cancelled due to itinerary changes.

title: 'My wife is way more attracted to me now': Carlsen after record rating in freestyle
content: Magnus Carlsen, the chess maestro, has shattered barriers by exceeding a 2900 rating in freestyle chess, a milestone previously unattained in classical chess. This achievement, based on Freestyle Chess organization ratings, marks a new high for Carlsen, surpassing his peak classical rating. Among Indian players, Praggnanandhaa shines at fourth place, followed by other notable players like Arjun Erigaisi and Gukesh.

title: Latest discovery: Are we living inside a black hole? Nasa‚Äôs James Webb findings stun scientists
content: The James Webb Space Telescope has observed a surprising alignment in the spin directions of ancient galaxies, challenging the standard cosmological model. A significant portion of these galaxies rotate in the same direction, suggesting a hidden order in the early universe.

title: ‚ÄòAnti-worker move to downsize...‚Äô: TCS new staff policy slammed; here‚Äôs what IT union said
content: Tata Consultancy Services' new policy mandating 225 billing days and limiting bench time to 35 days faces criticism from the All India IT & ITeS Employees' Union. The union alleges the policy is a disguised attempt to downsize teams and an anti-worker measure.

title: Pacers riding high, not celebrating Game 6 rout
content: The Pacers gave their home crowd plenty to cheer about in Thursday night's blowout win, including a highlight-reel dunk by Pascal Siakam, but they were in no mood to celebrate with Game 7 around the corner.

title: Ohtani, Tatis hit again as L.A.-S.D. feud boils over
content: Benches cleared, Shohei Ohtani and Fernando Tatis Jr. were both hit by pitches, and even the two managers got into it during another contentious affair between the Dodgers and Padres.

title: Dodgers ask feds to leave; team delays initiatives
content: The Dodgers, who said they denied federal immigration agents access to the stadium's parking lot, have postponed plans to unveil initiatives to assist immigrant communities.

title: Ex-NBA star Divac breaks hip in motorcycle crash
content: Former NBA center Vlade Divac underwent emergency surgery after breaking a hip in a fall from his motorcycle in Montenegro, doctors said.

title: Rays' Bigge hit by foul ball in dugout, carted off
content: Rays pitcher Hunter Bigge was carted off the field in a frightening scene after he was struck by a foul ball in the dugout.

content: Pittsburgh's Dennis Santana was involved in an altercation with a fan he said "crossed the line a few times" Thursday night in Detroit.

content: The United States has advanced at the Gold Cup, but the performances from the attacking players must improve.

content: The Lakers have spent decades lagging behind other NBA teams in ways known -- and not. This sale presents a massive opportunity for them to catch up -- and expedite their chase for title No. 18.

content: Bayern Munich will have no room for complacency when they face Argentina's Boca Juniors in their second Group C match, the German club's coach Vincent Kompany said on Thursday.

content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday slammed the RJD for allegedly insulting Babasaheb Bhim Rao Ambedkar and asserted that the people of Bihar would not tolerate any disrespect to the Dalit icon.

title: Palestine Activists Break Into UK's Largest Air Base, Deface 2 Aircraft
content: Pro-Palestinian activists broke into the UK's largest air force base in southeast England and vandalised two planes in an act condemned by Prime Minister Keir Starmer as "disgraceful" on Friday.

title: 8 Core Sectors' Growth Slows Down To 0.7% In May, Lowest In 9 Months
content: India's eight core sectors' growth slowed down to 0.7 per cent, lowest in nine months, in May 2025 against 6.9 per cent in the same month last year, according to the latest government data released on Friday.

title: India's Forex Reserves Rise $2.29 Billion To $698.95 Billion
content: India's forex reserves rose USD 2.294 billion to USD 698.95 billion for the week ended June 13, the RBI said on Friday.

title: US' Afghan War Veteran Tears Into Trump's "Lack Of Seriousness" Over Iran
content: Anna Kelly, the White House deputy press secretary, said in a statement, responding to Moore's comment, "Americans overwhelmingly elected President Trump because they trust him to keep our country safe."

title: PM Modi Launches 105 Projects Worth Over Rs 18,600 Crore In Odisha
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched 105 development projects valued at over Rs 18,600 crores, unveiled the "Odisha Vision Document" and flagged off new trains during his visit to the state.

title: Netanyahu's Other Battle: Swinging Trump And US Behind Iran War
content: Since launching air strikes on Iran last week, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has been working to pull President Donald Trump into the war and sway a sceptical American public.

title: World May Exhaust 1.5 Degree Celsius Carbon Budget In 3 Years: Scientists
content: If the world continues to release carbon dioxide at the current rate, the carbon budget for limiting global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius will be exhausted in just over three years, according to an international group of scientists.

title: PM Modi Joins Tiranga Yatra, Holds Roadshow In Bhubaneswar
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi was accorded a grand welcome here on Friday after he landed at the Biju Patnaik International Airport here, before taking part in a Tiranga Yatra and a roadshow.

content: Aman Gupta, the co-founder of boAt Lifestyle, took listeners back to a very different Goa during a conversation on The Prakhar Gupta Xperience podcast.

content: Delhi Police has busted a large-scale fake degree racket and arrested five people for their alleged involvement in fabricating and distributing forged academic certificates, an official on Friday said.

title: India, US, China Record Lower Swiss Bank Deposits Over 10 Years
content: Deposits of Indian customers in Swiss banks have declined by around 18 per cent over the past decade, according to the latest figures released by the Swiss National Bank.

title: Woman Killed, Dragged 100 Metres By Tiger In Karnataka
content: A 32-year-old woman was killed in a tiger attack near Omkar range in Chamarajanagara district under Bandipur Tiger Reserve limits, officials said on Friday.

title: India To Organise Yoga Day Events In 191 Countries Tomorrow
content: India will organise thematic events and programmes in 1,300 cities across the globe to mark the International Day of Yoga on Saturday, showcasing the nation's ancient tradition and soft power.

content: In a big embarrassment for the Congress government in Karnataka, an audio of party MLA BR Patil flagging corruption in the housing department has gone viral, prompting jabs from the BJP, which has accused the party of "looting" the state.

content: A 44-year-old Florida man snuck into a random house to avoid going home to his angry wife following a quarrel. Joe broke into a house in Davenport, stayed there for several days, cooked meals and even had a luxurious bath.

content: Iran has opened its otherwise closed airspace exclusively for Indian evacuation flights. At least 1,000 Indian students stranded in conflict-hit Iranian cities are expected to land in Delhi in the next two days as part of the government's emergency

content: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) chief Lalu Yadav today released a 'Bihar AI' parody video taking swipes at Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who is on a visit to the state where the assembly election is scheduled to be held later this year.

title: 2 Killed, 2 Injured As Bikes Collide Head-On In UP, None Wore Helmets
content: Two youths were killed, and two others sustained serious injuries following a head-on collision between two motorcycles on the service lane of the Purvanchal Expressway in Sultanpur, officials said on Friday.

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: ‚ÄòWas made to wait by Nixon‚Äô: BJP MP compares Indira‚Äôs 1971 US visit with Modi‚Äôs diplomacy
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports .

title: What's wrong with the Aces? Breaking down Las Vegas' 5-6 start
content: the Las Vegas Aces are 5-6, having lost four of their past five . they are tied for seventh place in the WNBA in scoring average, offensive and defensive rating and net rating . three-time MVP A'ja Wilson has missed the past three games in concussion protocol .

title: Is the Club World Cup important? Yes, just ask the South American teams
content: Boca Juniors fans get ready for the club world cup with chants and drums on Miami beach . the tournament feels unmistakably South American, but in the u.s. it's a global tournament . many of their UEFA counterparts shrug with apathy at the expanded tournament, noting its lack of history .

title: Transfer window weekly: Napoli chase N√∫√±ez; Chelsea eye Jo√¢o Pedro
content: the club world cup transfer window has closed . but the club's main window is open with the rest of Europe to follow on July 1 . sportsmail's reporters hearing about possible deals every Friday until September . 'the anfield wrap' is looking at which Premier League games Liverpool might have after Champions League knockout games .

title: Recruiting intel from Elite 11 Finals and June's final official visit weekend
content: 20 of the nation's top high school quarterbacks convened in Southern California for the Elite 11 Finals . from Tuesday night to Thursday morning, 20 headliners convene in southern California . among the headliners are five-star passers in the 2026 ESPN 300 . a final round of official visits before the recruiting dead period from June 23 to July 31 .

title: NBA draft trades: Five deals that would shake up the first round
content: the NBA offseason has officially arrived . there are massive storylines yet to resolve, including the Los Angeles Lakers sale . the NBA draft is just days away, and free agency just days after that . here are five trades featuring 10 different teams .

title: Ranking the 10 most unbreakable records in college football
content: college football has evolved greatly over the years, but there are some records and accomplishments that have stood the test of time . we've examined the past 75 years in college football, tracing back to the 1950 season, and have ranked the 10 most "unbreakable" records in the sport, listing them in order of least likely to be topped.

title: Expert picks, best bets for UFC Fight Night and PFL semifinals
content: light heavyweights jamahal Hill and Khalil Rountree will clash in the main event . MMA veteran and former UFC fighter Kevin Lee will make his PFL debut against Gadzhi Rabadanov . former Bellator champion Liz Carmouche takes on Elora Dana .

title: Why there's a 30-foot, 15K-pound fiberglass tiger circling the Men's College World Series
content: a version of this story ran before the semifinal round of the men's college world series . it has been updated to reflect LSU advancing the championship series against Coastal Carolina . "LSU Pregame" was the first song, and Greene's uncle, Jacob Stone, steered the 15,000-pound fiberglass tiger around traffic .

content: The case was earlier investigated by Crime Branch. Omana, Gokul‚Äôs mother, had moved Kerala High Court with a request to hand over the case to CBI as the suspects were  police officers

content: She says imposing Hindi will be detrimental as India remains a land where various languages are spoken

content: The task of preparing the DPR for the greenfield highway had been given to a Hyderabad agency in December 2017, NHAI had said in its response to a petition

title: Dhankhar slams Supreme Court over Emergency-era verdict, says darkest in judicial history
content: According to an official statement, he said the judgment of the Supreme Court overruling that of nine High Courts legitimised dictatorship and authoritarianism.

title: K.C. Venugopal slams Governor, questions CM‚Äôs silence
content: Congress leader says Governor should not act as an RSS volunteer. He seeks to know why CM is not bringing to the notice of the President and the Prime Minister the ‚Äòunconstitutional‚Äô activities taking place in Raj Bhavan

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: 3.5 lakh plantation workers still receive only ‚Çπ2 per day as DA
content: The workers in the 86 of 87 sections included in the Minimum Wages Act receive ‚Çπ87.40 per day as DA except the plantation sector. Dearness Allowance of the plantation workers have not seen an increase in the past 50 years

title: Everyday, over 40,000 cars travel to Hyderabad airport; TGSRTC buses make only 400 trips
content: A transport planner said passengers who have to catch flight avoid taking buses to airport. Experts point at need for reliable, affordable bus network.

title: Centre sets up panel to examine reliance of students on coaching, fairness of entrance exams
content: "The reasons behind the emergence of 'dummy schools' will be examined and the panel will study their role in encouraging full-time coaching at the cost of formal schooling and suggest ways to mitigate them," the official added.

title: ICU bed capacity increased at Alappuzha MCH
content: As part of the expansion of the Multidisciplinary Intensive Care Unit (MDICU) at the hospital, 10 beds have been added in the Medicine department at a cost of ‚Çπ12 lakh.

title: In last 11 years, cleaning Ganga has become election jumla: Congress
content: Congress general secretary in-charge communications Jairam Ramesh claimed that not only in Bihar, "Mother Ganga" has become more polluted than ever before throughput its stretch

title: First batch of 33 pilgrims leaves for Kailash Manasarovar Yatra via Sikkim's Nathula
content: ‚ÄúGovernor Om Prakash Mathur flagged off the yatra at a function held at the Sino-Indian frontier in East Sikkim,‚Äù officials said

title: ED seizes Delhi govt files, over 300 passbooks in classroom 'scam' searches
content: The AAP had termed the ED action a "desperate" attempt to divert public attention and asserted that the allegations against its leaders were "politically motivated"

title: BJP accounts for nearly 45% of total election spending in 2024 Lok Sabha polls: ADR
content: Publicity topped the list of expenses, with the parties spending ‚Çπ2,008 crore, or more than 53%, of their total declared expenditure on it.

title: PM Modi launches 105 projects worth over ‚Çπ18,600 crore, unveils Vision Document
content: The vision aims to transform Odisha into a Dollar 500 billion economy by 2036 and a Dollar 1.5 trillion economy by 2047.

title: Wife need not obtain husband‚Äôs signature to apply for passport: Madras High Court

title: After 13 attempts, a reluctant pregnant tribal woman in Tamil Nadu persuaded into hospital visit

content: The aircraft landed safely and the bird hit was detected after it touched down in Pune, the airline said in a statement.
